item.title: QA Tech II **MUST have IPC A 610/D certification** (dublin / pleasanton / livermore)
item.description:
****THIS IS A TEMP TO HIRE POSTION****
Medical Device Company located in Pleasanton,CA.
5:00am to 1:30pm
Monday-Friday
$18.50 per hour to start, if the temporary employee does well, will be converted to permanent full-time after 90 days. The position is bonus and benefit eligible.
***PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS AD IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A CURRENT IPC A 610/D CERTIFICATION--CLIENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A COPY OF THE CERTIFICATION ALONG WITH RESUME SUBMISSION***

SUMMARY:
Performs or assists in performing quality assurance responsibilities in routine and non-routine tasks to apply, and maintain quality requirements for processing components and other materials into finished goods and products. Under general supervision, works with quality assurance and manufacturing personnel to ensure effective inspection and testing procedures are implemented and maintained. Minimal instructions needed on routine work and general instructions given on new lines of work or special assignments. Scope of responsibility is well defined, but requires some use of judgment. This is an intermediate level position.

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Assists in the development and implementation of new inspection and testing procedures.
 Reviews device history records, manufacturing records and Quality Assurance records to verify that the information is accurate and complete and that all specifications have been met.
 Ensures that product, at all stages of inspection, and maintains proper identification, traceability, and inspection and test status.
 Assist in continuous improvement activities such as process validation, test procedure validation, first article inspection, source inspection and other engineering studies.
 Performs general receiving inspection, in-process, and final inspection of product, packaging and labeling.
 Conducts visual, dimensional and functional inspection and testing as directed by quality assurance procedures and other specifications.
 Performs physical testing such as packaging peel tests; polymer product break load and ultimate elongation.
 Generates nonconformance reports and follows through on disposition of nonconforming product. Understands the general types of defects and failure modes that can occur in product. Coordinates with production and materials control personnel to identify scope of and quarantine non-conforming product.
 Participates in internal ISO/GMP/QSR audits.
 Supports Quality Systems Manager or Engineer on corrective action, failure investigations and customer complaints.
 Assists in cross-training other QA Technicians.
 Performs other duties as required by the Quality Assurance Operations Management.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
AA degree or technical education with a minimum of three years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Previous medical device industry experience strongly preferred.

Must be knowledgeable in using measurement equipment and tools such as calipers, gages, micrometers, etc.

Understanding of basic inspection techniques.

PCBA experience and IPC-A-610/D certification is required.

Must be able to read blueprints and schematics. Proficiency in using basic math skills to obtain test and inspection results.

Experience in or familiarity with, and can implement FDA GMP, ISO, and Quality Systems Regulations.

Must be familiar with current software such as Microsoft Excel, Word, Access, which are used in generating reports and statistics.

Good verbal and written communication skills.

Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
item.dc:title: QA Tech II **MUST have IPC A 610/D certification** (dublin / pleasanton / livermore)
